Znana Slovenka razkrila: V šoli sem bila žrtev nasilja
Radijka in komičarka Tanja Kocman je spregovorila o travmah iz otroštva.
01 Nov 2019, 14:17 by A. K.



Tanja se danes ne ubada več s kritikami. FOTO: TIBOR GOLOB



Bila je drugačna, zato je bila večkrat tarča posmeha. FOTO: INSTAGRAM


Otroci in najstniki so lahko mnogokrat okrutni do vrstnikov, kar je na lastni koži kot deklica občutila tudi radijka in komičarka Tanja Kocman. »Ker sem bila malenkost drugačna kot drugi. Nekaj kilogramov več in rdečkasti lasje znajo v ljudeh vzbuditi najslabše. Norčevanje, žaljenje in tudi fizično obračunavanje zavoljo tega, ker se nekaterim ne zdiš po meri, so še zdaj marsikje del šolske prakse,« se spominja neprijetnih trenutkov, za katere pa je danes tudi hvaležna.»Ne glede na to, koliko me je prizadelo, sem danes izjemno hvaležna, saj sem prav zaradi tega na tisti strani ljudi, ki videza ne izpostavljajo kot neke vrste uniformo, ki mora biti za vse enaka. Da danes nisem človek, ki bi si jemal pravico do obsojanja in norčevanja. Da danes vem, kaj šteje,« pravi Tanja, ki najstnikom, ki se spravljajo na sošolce oziroma vrstnike in ki se jim zdi, da je šolsko dvorišče njihovo življenje, polaga na srce, naj se raje vpišejo na šahovski krožek kot pa med tiste, ki bodo ves čas šolanja svoje frustracije zdravili s poniževanjem drugih.
Svojo vrednost dojemam po širini srca in ne po širini bokov.
»Po vseh letih izobraževanja zelo malo vem o odvodih in integralih. Vem pa to, da svojo vrednost dojemam po širini srca in ne po širini bokov. In tako dojemam tudi tvojo. Zato, prosim, nehajmo ... Naj minejo žalostni časi, ko mi kup mozoljastih najstnikov s prezgodnjim izlivom javno demonstrira, kaj v tem življenju res šteje,« še dodaja Tanja.

Famous Slovenian woman revealed: I was a victim of violence at school
Radio and comedian Tanja Kocman spoke about childhood traumas.
01 Nov 2019, 14:17 by A.K.



Tanja is no longer dealing with criticism today. PHOTO: TIBOR Pigeon



She was different, so she was repeatedly the target of ridicule. PHOTO: INSTAGRAM


Children and teenagers can often be cruel to their peers, which was also felt by radio and comedian Tanja Kocman on her own skin as a girl. “Because I was a little different from the others. A few pounds more and reddish hair can excite the worst in people. Mocking, insulting, and also physical billing because you don't feel like it is custom, are still part of the school practice, "she recalls the embarrassing moments she is grateful for." No matter how much I was hurt. , I am extremely grateful today, because that is why I am on the side of people who do not look like a uniform that must be the same for everyone. That today I am not a man who takes the right to be judged and ridiculed. That I know what counts today, "says Tanja, who puts it to the heart of teens who are classmates or peers who feel that their schoolyard is their life, should rather enroll in a chess circle than among those who who will cure their frustration throughout the school by humiliating others.
I perceive my value by the width of my heart, not by the width of my hips.
“After all my years of education, I know very little about drains and integrals. But I know that I perceive my value by the width of my heart, not by the width of my hips. And so I perceive yours as well. So, please, stop ... Let the sad times pass when a bunch of pimply teenagers with a premature ejaculation publicly demonstrate what really counts in this life, "Tanja adds.
